title: Understanding Refeeding
text: Refeeding is a critical process in the treatment of individuals with anorexia. It involves the careful reintroduction of food to prevent complications.

title: Why is Refeeding Important?
text: Refeeding is essential because it helps restore nutritional balance and prevent refeeding syndrome, a potentially fatal condition.

hintAnswer: starting of oral intake for clients with anorexia
title: Identifying Refeeding
text: Which of the following best describes refeeding?
choices: there is a reduction in essential nutrients needed to maintain adequate bodily functions
a newer eating disorder characterized as a disturbance with eating or feeding where nutritional or energy needs are continuously not met
starting of oral intake for clients with anorexia
